title: River Hull Walking Route

images.title: Peter Church / The river Hull to Tickton, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The River Hull to Tickton

images.title: Paul Glazzard / Beverley Beck, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The inner lock gates at the eastern end of Beverley Beck near its junction with the River Hull. The lock gates and pumping station were restored in early 2007. Beverley Beck was improved into a navigable canal to allow barges and other shipping to travel into the centre of Beverley.

images.title: Andy Beecroft / Tickton Bridge Structure, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Tickton Bridge Structure at Hull Bridge. This carries the A1035 Beverley to White Cross road over the River Hull.

images.title: Paul Lakin [CC BY 3.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Tickton

images.title: Stephen Horncastle / River Hull & Lake
images.caption: River Hull and Lake. East south east of Arram, East Riding of Yorkshire.

images.title: Paul Harrop / Arram Beck meets the River Hull
images.caption: Arram Beck meets the River Hull in the Pulfin Nature Reserve. This is north of the route if you would like to extend your exercise.

images.title: Peter Church / The river Hull to Tickton
images.caption: The river Hull to Tickton. The primary flow of the river is in the direction of the photograph, at high tide it flows in the opposite direction.

images.title: Entrance Lock to Leven Canal (disused) by Martin Dawes, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Entrance Lock to Leven Canal (disused)

description: Enjoy a walk along the Beverley Beck and the River Hull on this pleasant waterside walk in Beverley. The route runs for just under 5 miles on a series of very flat, public footpaths. The walk starts at the Beverley Beck, just a short distance east of the Minster and train station. Follow the pleasant footpath east until it meets with the River Hull at the recently restored lock gates and pumping house. You then turn north toward Tickton where you can cross the river and follow the path on the eastern side for a while. The route then crosses back to the western side and follows the beck back into Beverley. To continue your walking in the area pick up the Beverley Twenty long distance circular walk and explore the countryside surrounding the town. Our Tickton and Leven Canal Walk will take you north along the river to the now disused Leven Canal. There's nice footpaths here to follow into the village.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head south west and you could visit the neighbouring village of Skidby. The main attraction here is the Grade II listed Skidby Mill which dates back to 1821. The working mill includes an interesting museum and a fine restaurant with a landscaped garden. For more walking ideas in the area see the Yorkshire Wolds Walks page.

display_address: Beckside, Beverley, East Riding of Yorkshire, England, HU17 0PE, United Kingdom
